## Occam's Razor

Occam's razor is a problem-solving rule that suggests choosing the simplest explanation when there are multiple options. It's named after William of Ockham, a philosopher who lived in the 1300s. The idea is to pick the explanation with the fewest parts or assumptions, as long as it explains the situation just as well as the more complex ones. This helps avoid making up unnecessary details. It's often summarized as, "Keep it simple."
title: Occam's razor
